html: The two northern rulers’ scheme to invade the Kingdom of Judah and replace Ahaz with one of their own—the son of Tabeal—is an “evil” plot (ra‘a) because it contravenes Jehovah’s unconditional promise to King David of an everlasting dynasty of kings to rule on David’s throne (Psalm 89:3-4; Jeremiah 33:17-21). The name Tabeal—a compound of the words “not” (’al) and “good” (tab/tob)—implies that the proposed puppet ruler is not a descendant of David. Because the word “good” signifies covenant keeping and covenant blessing, a name that means “No Good” implies the opposite.
